alert.note: Alert for Central Columbia River Gorge (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 19 at 9:17PM PST until December 20 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches along the Columbia River and 4 to 10 inches for elevations above 500 feet. * WHERE...In Washington, Central Columbia River Gorge. In Oregon, Central Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...Until noon PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While rain has been slow to transition over to snow for elevations below 500 feet, the transition over to wet snow is still expected to occur at some point Sunday night, most likely between 11 PM PST Sunday and 3 AM PST Monday. There is also a chance of freezing rain for a brief period of time Sunday night and Monday morning from Cascade Locks eastward to Hood River, especially for elevations above 500 feet.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions visit https://www.tripcheck.com or https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map or by calling 5 1 1
